intro: Trigonostemon honbaensis, commonly known as the Honbaensis Trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
